definitions.definition: A company whose business is based around a website or primarily via the Internet.
To convert to using or being based on e-commerce.
A fixed bunk for sleeping (in caravans, trains, etc).
Room for maneuvering or safety. (Often used in the phrase a wide berth.)
A space for a ship to moor or a vehicle to park.
A room in which a number of the officers or ship's company mess and reside.
A job or position, especially on a ship.
Position or seed in a tournament bracket.
Position on the field of play
To bring (a ship or vehicle) into its berth
The amount by which the market value of a property falls below the amount of the mortgage secured upon it.
The situation in which a property is worth less than its mortgage.
Short for obviously.
Carried or used on or in a vehicle or vessel
(by extension) Being a part of, being included in, participating in
definitions.example: James is onboard as a production manager.

definitions.definition: A band worn around the leg to hold up a sock or stocking.
A bendlet.
To fasten with a garter
Any of the single-celled or multicellular organisms of the taxonomic domain Eukaryota, whose cells contain at least one distinct nucleus.
A barrier on the side of a road, to keep vehicles on the road.
The body of a motor vehicle (as opposed to the chassis).
A sector of a nation's economy that is illegally undocumented due to cash payments or tax avoidance
definitions.example: No one knows how large the black economy really is.

definitions.definition: A man's personal male attendant, responsible for his clothes and appearance.
A hotel employee performing such duties for guests.
(professional wrestling) A female performer in professional wrestling, acting as either a manager or personal chaperone; often used to attract and titillate male members of the audience.
A female chaperone who accompanies a man, and is usually not married to him.
A person employed to clean or park cars.
A person employed to assist the jockey and trainer at a racecourse.
A wooden stand on which to hold clothes and accessories in preparation for dressing.
A kind of goad or stick with an iron point.
To serve (someone) as a valet.
To clean and service (a car), as a valet does.
To leave (a car) with a valet to park it.
A master-at-arms onboard a Royal Navy ship
Airy; showy; finical.
(by extension) Characterized by an affected or fantastical manner.
Dapper or stylish.
definitions.example: He wore a jaunty outfit that was all the rage.

definitions.definition: Ostentatiously self-confident.
definitions.example: He walked down the street with a jaunty swaggering step, as if daring others less perfectly satisfied to intrude upon his good mood.

definitions.definition: To reclaim ownership of property for which payment remains due.
To gain back possession of.
definitions.example: to repossess oneself of something lost

definitions.definition: An army rank; an officer commanding a brigade.
The highest field officer grade, below general officers, NATO grade O7
An act of wavering, vacillating, etc.
Someone who waves, enjoys waving, etc.
definitions.example: I felt encouraged by all the enthusiastic wavers in the crowd.

definitions.definition: Someone who specializes in waving (hair treatment).
A tool that accomplishes hair waving.
A sapling left standing in a fallen wood.
To sway back and forth; to totter or reel.
definitions.example: Flowers wavered in the breeze.

definitions.definition: To flicker, glimmer, quiver, as a weak light.
To fluctuate or vary, as commodity prices or a poorly sustained musical pitch.
To shake or tremble, as the hands or voice.
definitions.example: His voice wavered when the reporter brought up the controversial topic.

definitions.definition: To falter; become unsteady; begin to fail or give way.
To be indecisive between choices; to feel or show doubt or indecision; to vacillate.
definitions.example: Despite all the terrible things that happened to her, she never wavered from her beliefs.

definitions.definition: To plate with bronze.
definitions.example: My mother bronzed my first pair of baby shoes.

definitions.definition: To color bronze; (of the sun) to tan.
(of the skin) To change to a bronze or tan colour due to exposure to the sun.
To make hard or unfeeling; to brazen.
The eggs of fish.
The sperm of certain fish.
The ovaries of certain crustaceans.
Short for roe deer.
A mottled appearance of light and shade in wood, especially in mahogany.

The act of beatifying, or the state of being beatified; especially, in the Roman Catholic Church, the act or process of ascertaining and declaring that a deceased person is one of "the blessed," or has attained the second degree of sanctity, — usually a stage in the process of canonization.
The point on the land or water surface directly above the focus, or hypocentre, of an earthquake.
The point on the surface of the earth directly above an underground explosion.
The focal point of any activity, especially if dangerous or destructive.
The geographical area in which an ongoing disaster, illness, crisis, or other destructive event is currently most severe.
Of an earthquake: to have its epicentre (at a specified location).
The braincase or neurocranium; that part of the skull consisting of the bones enclosing the brain, but not including the bones of the face or jaw.
The upper portion of the skull, including the neurocranium and facial bones, but not including the jawbone (mandible).
The skull.
A pal, buddy, mate, friend; often used in direct address by one male to another.
definitions.example: What's up, cobber?

definitions.definition: A sweet consisting of a small block of hard caramel covered in chocolate.
To make sweet to the taste.
definitions.example: to sweeten tea

definitions.definition: To make (more) pleasant or to the mind or feelings.
definitions.example: to sweeten friendship

definitions.definition: To make mild or kind; to soften.
definitions.example: to sweeten the temper

definitions.definition: To make less painful or laborious; to relieve.
definitions.example: to sweeten the cares of life

definitions.definition: To soften to the eye; to make delicate.
To make pure and salubrious by destroying noxious matter.
definitions.example: to sweeten rooms or apartments that have been infected

definitions.definition: To make warm and fertile.
definitions.example: to dry and sweeten soils

definitions.definition: To restore to purity; to free from taint.
definitions.example: to sweeten water, butter, or meat

definitions.definition: To make more attractive; said of offers in negotiations.
To become sweet.
Of or relating to atheists or atheism
Mildly hungry
Irritable; crotchety
Of or pertaining to Peckham, a place in Southwark London.
Native to Peckham.
Tending toward or promoting integration
definitions.example: an integrative approach

definitions.definition: A heated greenhouse.
An environment in which growth or development is encouraged naturally or artificially; a hotbed.
A bagnio, or bathing house; a brothel.
A heated room for drying greenware.
A hot state in global climate.
(of a child) To provide with an enriched environment with the aim of stimulating academic development.
Erroneous in date; containing an anachronism; in a wrong time; not applicable to or not appropriate for the time.
definitions.example: If you know where to look in the movie, you can spot an anachronistic wrist watch on one of the Roman soldiers.

definitions.definition: (of a person) Having opinions from the past; preferring things or values of the past; behind the times; overly conservative.
Prejudice or bias against persons on the basis of their skin color or complexion, often among persons of the same racial identification.
A style of painting characterised by the use of intense color.
Stylish, high-toned, upscale.
A simpleton.
An inferior kind of cannel coal from Scottish collieries, having a slaty structure.
A narrow strip of wood split or peeled from a larger piece.
A dental device applied consequent to undergoing orthodontia.
A device to immobilize a body part.
A segment of armour consisting of a narrow overlapping plate.
A bone found on either side of a horse's cannon bone; the second or fourth metacarpal (forelimb) or metatarsal (hindlimb) bone.
A disease affecting the splint bones, as a callosity or hard excrescence.
To apply a splint to; to fasten with splints.
To support one's abdomen with hands or a pillow before attempting to cough.
To split into thin, slender pieces; to splinter.
Each of the signs ( and ); parenthesis, bracket (in a strict sense).
A light wind from the west.
Any light refreshing wind; a gentle breeze.
Anything of fine, soft, or light quality, especially fabric.
To blow or move like a zephyr, or light breeze.
To blow or blow on gently like a zephyr; to cool or refresh with a gentle breeze.
To get the flavor of.
To indicate or suggest something; used with of.
definitions.example: Her reckless behavior smacks of pride.

definitions.definition: To have a particular taste; used with of.
To slap someone.
To make a smacking sound.
To strike a child (usually on the buttocks) as a form of discipline. (US spank)
To wetly separate the lips, making a noise, after tasting something or in expectation of a treat.
To kiss with a close compression of the lips, so as to make a sound when they separate.
A series of smacks; the act by which somebody is smacked.
definitions.example: children who received regular smackings

definitions.definition: The art of studying the different parts of any organized body, to discover their situation, structure, and economy.
The science that deals with the form and structure of organic bodies; anatomical structure or organization.
definitions.example: Animal anatomy is also called zootomy; vegetable anatomy, phytotomy; and human anatomy, anthropotomy.

definitions.definition: A treatise or book on anatomy.
(by extension) The act of dividing anything, corporeal or intellectual, for the purpose of examining its parts.
definitions.example: Burton's famous treatise, "The Anatomy of Melancholy"

definitions.definition: The form of an individual.
definitions.example: I went to the Venice beach body-building competition and noticed the competitor from Athens, and let me tell you, that's what I call classic Greek anatomy.

definitions.definition: The human body, especially in reference to the private parts.
A skeleton, or dead body.
The physical or functional organization of an organism, or part of it.
A police section specialized in vice crimes.
The act of making such a sale.
To persuade a customer to buy more than he or she had intended.
A sweatshirt, with an integral hood and, sometimes, a large kangaroo pocket at the front.
definitions.example: You can buy hoodies on the cheap in summer.

definitions.definition: (often with negative connotation of yobbishness) A young person wearing such a sweatshirt, usually a male.
definitions.example: The wolf was accused of attacking a young girl, but it pleaded that it was simply motivated by the Prime Minister's speech to hug a hoodie.

definitions.definition: Foreskin
Hooded crow, Corvus cornix
The hooded crow.
The hooded gull.
Characteristic of inner-city life, especially that of crime-ridden ghettos.
The act of slipping, especially from a secure location.
The amount by which something has slipped.
A lessening of performance or achievement.
definitions.example: Supply-chain problems led to a slippage in production last week.

definitions.definition: A decrease in motion, or in the power of a mechanical system due to slipping.
The difference between estimated and actual transaction costs.
A video and/or audio broadcast transmitted via the Internet
To make such a broadcast
Cured meat from the sides, belly or back of a pig.
Thin slices of the above in long strips.
The police or spies.
definitions.example: Run! It's the bacon!

definitions.definition: Road rash.
A saucisse.
A soldier belonging to a legion; a professional soldier of the ancient Roman army.
A member of a legion, such as the American Legion, or of any organization containing the term legion in its title (e.g. the French Foreign Legion).
Relating to, or consisting of, a legion or legions.
definitions.example: a legionary force

definitions.definition: Containing a great number.
An appointed official whose duty is to investigate complaints, generally on behalf of individuals such as consumers or taxpayers, against institutions such as companies and government departments.

A designated internal mediator in an organization whose duty is to assist members with conflict resolution and other problems and to serve as an independent consultant to recommend changes to policies or procedures to improve organization effectiveness, efficiency, and humaneness.
An oven that features fans to recirculate heated air to accelerate heating provided by traditional radiant heat sources found in the oven
An extended narrative poem in elevated or dignified language, celebrating the feats of a deity, demigod (heroic epic), other legend or traditional hero.
definitions.example: The Icelandic epic took all night to recite.

definitions.definition: A series of events considered appropriate to an epic.
definitions.example: The book was an epic in four volumes.

definitions.definition: In software development, a large or extended user story.
Of, or relating to, an epic.
definitions.example: Beowulf is an epic poem.

definitions.definition: Momentously heroic; grand in scale or character
definitions.example: The epic defense was rewarded with the highest military decorations

definitions.definition: Extending beyond the usual or ordinary.
definitions.example: The after-prom party was truly epic.

definitions.definition: (of a morphism) That is an epimorphism.

One of the two magistrates who originally administered the census of citizens, and by Classical times (between the 8th century B.C.E. and the 6th century C.E.) was a high judge of public behaviour and morality.
definitions.example: The Ancient Roman censors were part of the cursus honorum, a series of public offices held during a political career, like consuls and praetors.

definitions.definition: An official responsible for the removal or suppression of objectionable material (for example, if obscene or likely to incite violence) or sensitive content in books, films, correspondence, and other media.
definitions.example: The headmaster was an even stricter censor of his boarding pupils’ correspondence than the enemy censors had been of his own when the country was occupied.

definitions.definition: A college or university official whose duties vary depending on the institution.
One who censures or condemns.

To review for, and if necessary to remove or suppress, content from books, films, correspondence, and other media which is regarded as objectionable (for example, obscene, likely to incite violence, or sensitive).
definitions.example: Occupying powers typically censor anything reeking of resistance

definitions.definition: A hypothetical subconscious agency which filters unacceptable thought before it reaches the conscious mind.
A type of recreational vehicle, a self-propelled structure built on a truck or bus chassis containing living accommodations.
A Jewish coming of age ceremony for a girl.
A girl who has come of age.
To initiate someone in a bat mitzvah ceremony.
Any bird of the family Fringillidae, seed-eating passerine birds, native chiefly to the Northern Hemisphere and usually having a conical beak.
To hunt for finches, to go finching.
To cause to feel shame.
definitions.example: I was shamed by the teacher's public disapproval.

definitions.definition: To cover with reproach or ignominy; to dishonor; to disgrace.
To drive or compel by shame.
definitions.example: The politician was shamed into resigning.

definitions.definition: To feel shame, be ashamed.
To mock at; to deride.
The activity by which somebody is shamed.
(grammar) A word that indicates an action, event, or state.
definitions.example: The word “speak” is an English verb.

definitions.definition: Any word; a vocable.
An action as opposed to a trait or thing.
definitions.example: Kindness is a verb, not an adjective. You're only kind if you do kind things.

definitions.definition: A named command that performs a specific operation on an object.
To use any word that is not, or had not been a verb (especially a noun) as if it were a verb.
(used as a neutral, unspecific verb) To perform any action that is normally expressed by a verb.
Coastal land that juts into the sea.
The unplowed boundary of a field.
A purplish mark on the skin due to leakage of blood from capillaries under the surface that have been damaged by a blow.
A dark mark on fruit or vegetables caused by a blow to the surface.
To strike (a person), originally with something flat or heavy, but now specifically in such a way as to discolour the skin without breaking it.
To damage the skin of (fruit or vegetables), in an analogous way.
Of fruit or vegetables, to gain bruises through being handled roughly.
definitions.example: Bananas bruise easily.

definitions.definition: To become bruised.
definitions.example: I bruise easily.

definitions.definition: To fight with the fists; to box.
A very famous or successful celebrity.
A highly contagious and sometimes fatal viral disease that can affect animals with cloven hooves.
Surgery using a fibre-optic laparoscope through a small incision, either for examination or treatment
A device that shoots a large amount of water at high pressure through a hose-like tube.
A Korean dish of white rice topped with vegetables, beef, a whole egg, and gochujang (chili pepper paste).
The buttocks.
definitions.example: Okay, everyone sit on your bum and try and touch your toes.

definitions.definition: The anus.
To sodomize; to engage in anal sex.
An expression of annoyance.
(sometimes derogatory) A homeless person, usually a man.
A lazy, incompetent, or annoying person, usually a man.
definitions.example: Fred is becoming a bum - he's not even bothering to work more than once a month.

definitions.definition: A player or racer who often performs poorly.
definitions.example: Trade him to another team, he's a bum!

definitions.definition: A drinking spree.
To ask someone to give one (something) for free; to beg for something.
definitions.example: Can I bum a cigarette off you?

definitions.definition: To stay idle and unproductive, like a hobo or vagabond; to loiter.
definitions.example: I think I'll just bum around downtown for awhile until dinner.

definitions.definition: To wet the end of a marijuana cigarette (spliff).
Of poor quality or highly undesirable.
definitions.example: bum note

definitions.definition: Unfair.
definitions.example: bum deal

definitions.definition: Injured and without the possibility of full repair, defective.
definitions.example: I can't play football anymore on account of my bum knee.

definitions.definition: Unpleasant or unhappy.
definitions.example: He had a bum trip on that mescaline.

definitions.definition: To depress; to make unhappy.
A humming noise.
To make a murmuring or humming sound.
A bumbailiff.
To release (an animal) from a stable.
Having a strong tendency to change.
Fluctuating; not constant.
Fickle.
Unpredictable.
Readily decomposable.
Radioactive, especially with a short half-life.
Reconnaissance.
Reconnoiter.
The smallest genetic unit that is capable of undergoing recombination.
A trailer without a front axle and with wheels only at the trailing end, designed to be pulled via a pivoting arrangement which also partially supports its weight.
A tractor-trailer or big rig: a semi-trailer plus the truck or tractor pulling it.
Anyone imprisoned because of their race, religion, or political views.
A remote control for a television.
definitions.example: The news is starting on the other channel; hand me the zapper.

definitions.definition: A device that electrocutes ("zaps") with a high voltage, e.g. a bug zapper.
(by extension) Anything that exterminates.
A simple sauce made from flour, milk and butter; Béchamel sauce.
Mayonnaise.
A recurring or dominant element; a theme.
definitions.example: See how the artist repeats the scroll motif throughout the work?

definitions.definition: A short melodic passage that is repeated in several parts of a work.
A decorative figure that is repeated in a design or pattern.
A decorative appliqué design or figure, as of lace or velvet, used in trimming.
The physical object or objects repeated at each point of a lattice. Usually atoms or molecules.
A basic element of a move in terms of why the piece moves and how it supports the fulfilment of a stipulation.
In a nucleotide or amino-acid sequence, pattern that is widespread and has, or is conjectured to have, a biological significance.
Items or an item of clothing that is worn on the foot; a shoe, sandal, etc.
A very tall building with a large number of floors.
A small sail atop a mast of a ship; a triangular skysail.
Anything very tall or high.
To restrict one’s personal consumption, generally of food, but sometimes other things, in various manners (totally, temporally, by avoiding particular items), often for religious or medical reasons.
definitions.example: Muslims fast during Ramadan and Catholics during Lent.

definitions.definition: Abstinence from food
A musical instrument endemic to the Top End of Australia, consisting of a long hollowed-out log, which, when blown into, produces a low, deep mesmerising drone with sweeping rhythms
An aircraft pilot. The use of the word may imply claims of superior airmanship, as in navy aviator vs. air force pilot.
An experimenter in aviation.
A flying machine.
A sound produced by hitting a drum repeatedly and rhythmically over short intervals.
The day when graduating medical-school students find out where they will serve as residents.
The day on which a sporting event takes place.

A small, bean-shaped, chewy candy/sweet with a firm coating and a jelly-like center, made of sugar, flavoring, coloring and sometimes starch or other thickener, and usually sold assorted in a wide variety of flavors and bright colors.
A person not adhering to a main world religion; a follower of a pantheistic or nature-worshipping religion.
definitions.example: This community has a surprising number of pagans.

definitions.definition: (by extension) An uncivilized or unsocialized person.
(by extension) An unruly, badly educated child.
Relating to, characteristic of religions that differ from main world religions.
definitions.example: Many converted societies transformed their pagan deities into saints.

definitions.definition: (by extension) Savage, immoral, uncivilized, wild.
To represent falsely; to inaccurately portray something.
definitions.example: The fraudster misrepresented himself as a lawyer.

definitions.definition: Eastern.
(especially theosophy) The Islamic declaration of belief in the unity of God, one of the five pillars, the formal content of which is the kalima (a minimal Islamic creed).
Relating to anthropology.
The time of day when the sun appears above the eastern horizon.
definitions.example: I'll meet you at the docks at sunrise.

definitions.definition: The change in color of the sky at dawn.
definitions.example: Did you see the beautiful sunrise this morning?

definitions.definition: Any great awakening.
definitions.example: It was the sunrise of her spirit.

definitions.definition: Any of various arachnids of the order Scorpiones, related to the spiders, characterised by two large front pincers and a curved tail with a venomous sting in the end.
definitions.example: The peasants put two scorpions in a large bottle, and then take wagers as to which will win the struggle. Slowly the scorpions circle each other, until one lashes out at the other, and strikes him dead.

definitions.definition: An ancient military engine for hurling stones and other missiles.
A very spiteful or vindictive person.
A cheerleading move in which one foot is pulled back and held up with both hands while the performer stands on the other foot.
A whip with points like a scorpion's tail.
Any of the large European beetles from the genus Melolontha that are destructive to vegetation.
Initially, at first, at the very start
definitions.example: To begin with, we moved the furniture out of the room.

definitions.definition: In the first place
definitions.example: Double my wages? You weren't paying me anything to begin with!
